headline: Chipotle is raising US prices after promising bigger portions
summary: Chipotle is raising its U.S. prices to offset inflation and to compensate for a promise to increase portion sizes.  Chipotle’s chief corporate affairs officer, Laurie Schalow, confirmed Friday that the Mexican restaurant chain was implementing a 2% price increase nationally.  Schalow said it's the first time the California-based company has raised its prices in more than a year.
